alert.note: Alert for Pitt (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 20 at 6:31AM EST until December 24 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tar River At Greenville affecting Pitt County. For the Tar River...including Greenville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tar River at Greenville. * WHEN...From this morning to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor flooding of low lying areas adjacent to the river can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM EST Wednesday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 13.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon before gradually falling through the rest of the week. It is forecast to fall below flood stage Saturday night. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 945 PM EST.
